security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The subprocess.Popen calls use hardcoded arguments for legitimate clipboard utilities (xclip, xsel) with no command injection risk. Scanner misidentified YAML frontmatter and argparse configuration as weak cryptography. URLs point to legitimate X.com compose pages. Safe to publish.

content.user_title: Publish Tweets and Threads to X Draft Using Browser Automation
content.value_statement: Publishing content to X requires manual typing or risky auto-posting tools. This skill uses browser automation to prepare tweets and save them to draft, ensuring full user review before any post goes live.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to X compose page using Playwright browser automation
Copy prepared content to system clipboard for cross-platform paste operations
Parse thread content and save each tweet to a draft thread on X
Support multi-language content including Chinese and English characters
limitations: Does not auto-publish and always saves to draft for user review
Requires user to be logged into X in the browser session
Only supports short tweets and threads with 3-10 tweets maximum
Requires Playwright MCP server to be installed and configured

use_cases.title: Quick Tweet Drafting
use_cases.description: Prepare and save short tweets to X draft for review before posting. Ideal for timely announcements or quick thoughts that need review.
use_cases.target_user: Content creators and social media managers

use_cases.title: Multi-Tweet Thread Creation
use_cases.description: Parse multi-part thread content and save each tweet to a draft thread on X. Thread numbering and formatting are preserved.

use_cases.title: Multi-Language Content Drafting
use_cases.description: Draft tweets in any language including Chinese, English, and other Unicode characters for review before posting.

best_practices: Always review drafts at x.com/compose/drafts before posting to verify content accuracy
Use the x-create skill first to plan thread content before using x-publish to save it
Verify character counts stay under 280 characters per tweet before drafting long content
anti_patterns: Do not request auto-publish because this skill only saves to draft for user review
Do not use this skill when the user wants to post immediately without review
Do not draft content without planning for user review and approval first

faq.question: Does x-publish post tweets immediately?
faq.answer: No. This skill always saves content to draft only. Users must manually review and post from the X drafts page at x.com/compose/drafts.

faq.question: What happens if I am not logged into X?
faq.answer: The skill will detect the login page and prompt you to log in to X first before running the command again.

faq.question: Can I edit the draft after saving?
faq.answer: Yes. All drafts are saved to your X account and can be edited at x.com/compose/drafts before posting.

faq.question: What is the maximum thread length supported?
faq.answer: Threads are limited to 3-10 tweets for practical use. Longer content should be split into multiple threads.

faq.question: Does this skill work on all platforms?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses Playwright MCP for browser automation and supports macOS, Windows, and Linux. The clipboard script supports all three platforms.

faq.question: What dependencies are required to use this skill?
faq.answer: You need Playwright MCP server for browser automation and Python 3.9 or higher with platform-specific clipboard libraries installed.
